title: How to Make Avgolemono Soup

steps.headline: Pat the chicken dry with paper towels.
steps.description: This will help promote a better sear later on.

steps.headline: Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
steps.description: (You can add your own spices if you want.)

steps.headline: Place the chicken in a pot of moderately hot oil.
steps.description: Safflower is recommended as it has a light taste and a high smoke point so it will not burn easy.

steps.headline: Sear the chicken (one side only).
steps.description: This will enhance the flavor of the dish and the texture of the meat.

steps.headline: Add 48 oz broth, 1/4 cup lemon juice, and bay leaves to chicken in the pot.
Cover the pot and turn heat to low.
Cook rice and set to the side.
Remove bay leaves when the chicken starts to break apart (after four or five hours).
Turn heat up again and bring the pot to a slow boil.
Remove the chicken from the pot, place it on a plate.
Start to shred and pull apart the chicken.
Shred it all.

steps.headline: Add chicken back to the boiling liquid in the pot.
Add cooked rice.
Crack 6-7 eggs into a bowl and add in 1/2 cup lemon juice.

Start adding hot broth, 1/2 cup at a time.

text: Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. This will help promote a better sear later on. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. (You can add your own spices if you want.) Place the chicken in a pot of moderately hot oil. Safflower is recommended as it has a light taste and a high smoke point so it will not burn easy. Sear the chicken (one side only). This will enhance the flavor of the dish and the texture of the meat. Add 48 oz broth, 1/4 cup lemon juice, and bay leaves to chicken in the pot. Bring to a slow boil. Cover the pot and turn heat to low.  Cook rice and set to the side.  Remove bay leaves when the chicken starts to break apart (after four or five hours).  Turn heat up again and bring the pot to a slow boil.  Remove the chicken from the pot, place it on a plate.  Start to shred and pull apart the chicken. (Using two forks works quite well.) Shred it all. (The size does not need to be consistent.) Add chicken back to the boiling liquid in the pot.  Add cooked rice.  Crack 6-7 eggs into a bowl and add in 1/2 cup lemon juice. The more eggs are added the thicker the soup will be. Whisk together until homogeneous.  Start adding hot broth, 1/2 cup at a time. Add at least 5 cups of hot broth to the egg mixture and continue to whisk as you do so. Slowly incorporating hot broth while mixing will prevent the egg from cooking too fast and will keep soup smooth. Poor egg mixture into pot slowly while stirring.  Enjoy!  Finished.
